channel.title: Arrested DevOps
channel.itunes:subtitle: There's always DevOps in the Banana Stand
channel.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
channel.itunes:summary: Arrested DevOps is the podcast that helps you achieve understanding, develop good practices, and operate your team and organization for maximum DevOps awesomeness.
channel.description: Arrested DevOps is the podcast that helps you achieve understanding, develop good practices, and operate your team and business for maximum DevOps awesomeness.

item.title: Application Configuration With Tim Gross And Adam Jacob - ADO69
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Matt and Bridget chat with Tim Gross (Joyent) and Adam Jacob (Chef) about configuration that travels with the application, diving into Habitat and ContainerPilot.
item.description: Matt and Bridget chat with Tim Gross (Joyent) and Adam Jacob (Chef) about configuration that travels with the application, diving into Habitat and ContainerPilot.

item.title: Devopsdays Minneapolis 2016 - ADO68
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Bridget chats about enterprise transformation and the democratizing effect of platforms with guests Charity Majors, Nicole Forsgren, Andrew Clay Shafer, and James Watters, in front of a live studio audience at devopsdays Minneapolis 2016.
item.description: Bridget chats about enterprise transformation and the democratizing effect of platforms with guests Charity Majors, Nicole Forsgren, Andrew Clay Shafer, and James Watters, in front of a live studio audience at devopsdays Minneapolis 2016.

item.title: ChefConf 2016 With Jon Cowie, Fletcher Nichol, And Annie Hedgpeth - ADO67
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Recorded at ChefConf 2016 in Austin, Texas, with delightful guests Annie Hedgpeth, Fletcher Nichol, and Jon Cowie. We talk about all the new hotness of Habitat and Chef Automate, as well as cover the experiences of five years span of ChefConf attendee experience. Plus, Trevor throws shade at 'DevOps 2.0'.
item.description: Recorded at ChefConf 2016 in Austin, Texas, with delightful guests Annie Hedgpeth, Fletcher Nichol, and Jon Cowie. We talk about all the new hotness of Habitat and Chef Automate, as well as cover the experiences of five years span of ChefConf attendee experience. Plus, Trevor throws shade at 'DevOps 2.0'.

item.title: CareerOps With Jill Jubinski And Peter Burkholder - ADO66
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Oh no! You've been laid off. How can you bounce back? Jill Jubinski and Peter Burkholder help guide you through returning to the good fight of gainful employment.
item.description: Oh no! You've been laid off. How can you bounce back? Jill Jubinski and Peter Burkholder help guide you through returning to the good fight of gainful employment.

item.title: Finding Signal In The Noise, With Aneel Lakhani And Jason Dixon - ADO65
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Bridget and Matt (in his triumphant return) chat with Aneel Lakhani (SignalFX) and Jason Dixon about modern monitoring, alerting, event streams, and more.
item.description: Bridget and Matt (in his triumphant return) chat with Aneel Lakhani (SignalFX) and Jason Dixon about modern monitoring, alerting, event streams, and more.

item.title: Devopsdays Toronto 2016 - ADO64
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Bridget goes to devopsdays Toronto, eh, and chats with speaker Sean Walberg (NFL), sponsor Sarah Kowalik (PagerDuty), and local organizers Steve Pereira (Statflo) and Dave Cliffe (PagerDuty). Special guest appearance by ADO editor and devopsdays Minneapolis organizer Joe Laha.
item.description: Bridget goes to devopsdays Toronto, eh, and chats with speaker Sean Walberg (NFL), sponsor Sarah Kowalik (PagerDuty), and local organizers Steve Pereira (Statflo) and Dave Cliffe (PagerDuty). Special guest appearance by ADO editor and devopsdays Minneapolis organizer Joe Laha.

item.title: Containers And Security With Ben Hughes And Jessie Frazelle - ADO63
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Bridget chats with lovable reprobate/returning guest Ben Hughes (Etsy) and badass container expert Jessie Frazelle (Mesosphere) about everyone's favorite topic: security.
item.description: Bridget chats with lovable reprobate/returning guest Ben Hughes (Etsy) and badass container expert Jessie Frazelle (Mesosphere) about everyone's favorite topic: security.

item.title: Speaking At Conferences With Katherine Daniels - ADO62
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Speaking at tech conferences: how do you get started? What should you expect? Katherine Daniels of Etsy (author, engineer, and frequent public speaker) chats with Bridget, offering insights about speaking at conferences.
item.description: Speaking at tech conferences: how do you get started? What should you expect? Katherine Daniels of Etsy (author, engineer, and frequent public speaker) chats with Bridget, offering insights about speaking at conferences.

item.title: Who Owns Your Availability? With Charity Majors And Pete Cheslock - ADO61
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Who owns your availability? Recent events in the npm community have rekindled the perennial discussion about dependency management and controlling points of potential failure. Long-time operations professionals Charity Majors (Hound) and Pete Cheslock (Threat Stack) join the ADO crew to discuss.
item.description: Who owns your availability? Recent events in the npm community have rekindled the perennial discussion about dependency management and controlling points of potential failure. Long-time operations professionals Charity Majors (Hound) and Pete Cheslock (Threat Stack) join the ADO crew to discuss.

item.title: Building Your Personal Brand With Andrea Javor And Michael Hedgpeth - ADO60
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Want to be a change agent inside your organization? Your "personal brand" is a critical factor in your success. Being considered relevant both inside and outside of your organization gives weight to your opinions and recommendations, and will directly influence the impact you have. Guests Andrea Javor (Beam Suntory) and Michael Hedgpeth (NCR) discuss methods on growing your brand, without self-aggrandizing boasts or claims of "thought leadership".
item.description: Want to be a change agent inside your organization? Your "personal brand" is a critical factor in your success. Being considered relevant both inside and outside of your organization gives weight to your opinions and recommendations, and will directly influence the impact you have. Guests Andrea Javor (Beam Suntory) and Michael Hedgpeth (NCR) discuss methods on growing your brand, without self-aggrandizing boasts or claims of "thought leadership".

item.title: Getting Down With GitLab With Job Van Der Voort - ADO59
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: GitLab's VP of Product, Job van der Voort, joins Matt for a frank discussion on GitLab's open company culture, the history of the project, and some of the challenges and benefits of working "in the open".
item.description: GitLab's VP of Product, Job van der Voort, joins Matt for a frank discussion on GitLab's open company culture, the history of the project, and some of the challenges and benefits of working "in the open".

item.title: Open Your Stack With JJ Asghar - ADO58
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: JJ Asghar joins us to help school Matt about what is going on in the OpenStack world
item.description: JJ Asghar joins us to help school Matt about what is going on in the OpenStack world

item.title: Vendors: Frenemies Or Friends? With Michael Ducy Of The Goat Farm - ADO57
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Arrested DevOps teams up with The Goat Farm (http://goatcan.do) to talk about the ways that sales folks, solution architects, and other vendor roles can help be a partner to your organization and not just a necessary evil
item.description: Arrested DevOps teams up with The Goat Farm (http://goatcan.do) to talk about the ways that sales folks, solution architects, and other vendor roles can help be a partner to your organization and not just a necessary evil

item.title: Chocolatey Goodness With Rob Reynolds - ADO56
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Rob Reynolds, creator of the popular Windows packaging tool Chocolatey, joins Trevor for a discussion on the future of the project, as well as some historical details on the journey so far.
item.description: Rob Reynolds, creator of the popular Windows packaging tool Chocolatey, joins Trevor for a discussion on the future of the project, as well as some historical details on the journey so far.

item.title: Open Source With Phil Dibowitz - ADO55
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Matt is joined by Facebook Production Engineer Phil Dibowitz to talk about the state of Open Source today, the changes it has gone through in his career, as well as some of the best ways to get started in the world of Open Source.
item.description: Matt is joined by Facebook Production Engineer Phil Dibowitz to talk about the state of Open Source today, the changes it has gone through in his career, as well as some of the best ways to get started in the world of Open Source.

item.title: Platforms With Kelsey Hightower And Andrew Clay Shafer - ADO54
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: If you build, deploy, and operate software in production, you have a platform. Andrew Clay Shafer and Kelsey Hightower discuss different choices available in the platform space, from unstructured to structured with all the considerations along the road to operational maturity.
item.description: If you build, deploy, and operate software in production, you have a platform. Andrew Clay Shafer and Kelsey Hightower discuss different choices available in the platform space, from unstructured to structured with all the considerations along the road to operational maturity.

item.title: 2015 In Review - ADO53
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: We’ve made it through two years of ADO! It seems like only yesterday that we recorded our first year-end episode (which you can listen to at arresteddevops.com/27). And we’re back again to talk about what 2015 was for us, in the world of DevOps, and the world of ADO. Plus, Matt and Bridget wax nostalgic about cable management from when we managed data centers.
item.description: We’ve made it through two years of ADO! It seems like only yesterday that we recorded our first year-end episode (which you can listen to at arresteddevops.com/27). And we’re back again to talk about what 2015 was for us, in the world of DevOps, and the world of ADO. Plus, Matt and Bridget wax nostalgic about cable management from when we managed data centers.

item.title: Measurement And Sharing With Nicole Forsgren - ADO52
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Chef's Dr. Nicole Forsgren has a frank talk with Matt about the often neglected portions of CAMS theory - Measurement and Sharing. She gives real-world, practical tips on how to use data to drive a transformation...and even how culture can be measured.
item.description: Chef's Dr. Nicole Forsgren has a frank talk with Matt about the often neglected portions of CAMS theory - Measurement and Sharing. She gives real-world, practical tips on how to use data to drive a transformation...and even how culture can be measured.

item.title: DevOpsDays 2015 Year In Review With John Willis - ADO51
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: DevOpsDays Core Organizer John Willis drops by to talk with the crew about some of the challenges (and fun) of organizing a DevOpsDays event. We also discuss the history of DevOpsDays, and share some fun war stories.
item.description: DevOpsDays Core Organizer John Willis drops by to talk with the crew about some of the challenges (and fun) of organizing a DevOpsDays event. We also discuss the history of DevOpsDays, and share some fun war stories.

item.title: Switching Teams: From Linux To Windows And Windows To Linux - ADO50
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: What are some of the gotcha's that exist when switching operating systems? Trevor talks with Matthew Walter about the differences that exist and their own challenges as they've started their journeys into new operating systems.
item.description: What are some of the gotcha's that exist when switching operating systems? Trevor talks with Matthew Walter about the differences that exist and their own challenges as they've started their journeys into new operating systems.

item.title: What Is New At Puppet? With Eric Sorenson - ADO49
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Special guest Eric Sorenson of Puppet Labs chats with Matt about all the new hotness with Puppet, including Application Orchestration. Plus, Matt and Eric put on their pundit hats and talk about the acquisition of Ansible by Red Hat.
item.description: Special guest Eric Sorenson of Puppet Labs chats with Matt about all the new hotness with Puppet, including Application Orchestration. Plus, Matt and Eric put on their pundit hats and talk about the acquisition of Ansible by Red Hat.

item.title: Test Driven Infrastructure With Arthur Maltson And Michael Goetz - ADO48
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Testing your infrastructure code is critical. But exactly HOW do you go about doing this? Matt talks with Arthur Maltson and Michael Goetz about using tools such as Test Kitchen, Chef Audit Mode, InSpec, and Chef Compliance to help you build confidence in your infracode.
item.description: Testing your infrastructure code is critical. But exactly HOW do you go about doing this? Matt talks with Arthur Maltson and Michael Goetz about using tools such as Test Kitchen, Chef Audit Mode, InSpec, and Chef Compliance to help you build confidence in your infracode.

item.title: Tis The Season...For Scaling! With Rob Cummings And Matt Curry - ADO47
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Holiday! It’s a time of merriment… and terror. Let’s talk about how to prepare for a known spike in traffic, and what’s worked (and hasn’t)!
item.description: Holiday! It’s a time of merriment… and terror. Let’s talk about how to prepare for a known spike in traffic, and what’s worked (and hasn’t)!

item.title: ITIL Eye For The DevOps Folks With Steven Boyd - ADO46
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: What's this ITIL thing all about? How can it complement DevOps? Can't we all just get along? Special guest Steven Boyd joins us to discuss how ITIL can help an organization, and help correct some misconceptions about what ITIL is (and is not).
item.description: What's this ITIL thing all about? How can it complement DevOps? Can't we all just get along? Special guest Steven Boyd joins us to discuss how ITIL can help an organization, and help correct some misconceptions about what ITIL is (and is not).

item.title: Creating DevOps Communities And Events With Andy Burgin, Dustin Collins, And Nathen Harvey - ADO45
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Andy Burgin, Dustin Collins, and Nathen Harvey join Matt and Trevor to talk about what it takes to create DevOps events, Meetups, and communities.
item.description: Andy Burgin, Dustin Collins, and Nathen Harvey join Matt and Trevor to talk about what it takes to create DevOps events, Meetups, and communities.

item.title: Infrastructure As Code With Joshua Timberman, Eric Sorenson, And Robyn Bergeron - ADO44
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: What does "infrastructure as code" actually mean? How is it different from configuration management? Special guests Joshua Timberman (Chef), Eric Sorenson (Puppet Labs), and Robyn Bergeron (Ansible) talk with Matt and Trevor about this very topic.
item.description: What does "infrastructure as code" actually mean? How is it different from configuration management? Special guests Joshua Timberman (Chef), Eric Sorenson (Puppet Labs), and Robyn Bergeron (Ansible) talk with Matt and Trevor about this very topic.

item.title: Cognitive Neuroscience With Courtney Nash & Lindsay Holmwood - ADO43
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Trevor and Bridget chat with Courtney Nash (O'Reilly Media) and Lindsay Holmwood (Australian Government Digital Transformation Office) about cognitive neuroscience. We'll talk about recognizing cognitive fallacies, the psychology of alert design, how to make your conference proposals their most appealing, and about empathy from a scientific point of view.
item.description: Trevor and Bridget chat with Courtney Nash (O'Reilly Media) and Lindsay Holmwood (Australian Government Digital Transformation Office) about cognitive neuroscience. We'll talk about recognizing cognitive fallacies, the psychology of alert design, how to make your conference proposals their most appealing, and about empathy from a scientific point of view.

item.title: ChatOps Extravaganza With Jason Hand, Sasha Rosenbaum, And Peter Burkholder - ADO42
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Matt & Trevor sit down with Jason Hand (VictorOps), Sasha Rosenbaum (10th Magnitude), and Peter Burkholder (Chef) to discuss ChatOps.
item.description: Matt & Trevor sit down with Jason Hand (VictorOps), Sasha Rosenbaum (10th Magnitude), and Peter Burkholder (Chef) to discuss ChatOps.

item.title: Podcast Me Maybe With Kyle Kingsbury - ADO41
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Matt, Trevor, and Bridget chat with Kyle Kingsbury (Stripe) about his research on failure in distributed systems.
item.description: Matt, Trevor, and Bridget chat with Kyle Kingsbury (Stripe) about his research on failure in distributed systems.

item.title: Building An Ops Team With Charity Majors, Patrick McDonnell, And MCR - ADO40
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Bridget and Trevor are joined by Charity Majors (Facebook), as well as Mike Rembetsy and Patrick McDonnell (Etsy) for a frank discussion on what goes into building a great ops team.
item.description: Bridget and Trevor are joined by Charity Majors (Facebook), as well as Mike Rembetsy and Patrick McDonnell (Etsy) for a frank discussion on what goes into building a great ops team.

item.title: Eating Sushi With Andrew Clay Shafer - ADO39
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Matt and Bridget sit down with Andrew Clay Shafer (finally!) at DevOpsDays Minneapolis to discuss his thoughts on what's going on with the DevOps world since 2009, as well as his opinions on podcasts having episode numbers. Sadly, no sushi was actually consumed.
item.description: Matt and Bridget sit down with Andrew Clay Shafer (finally!) at DevOpsDays Minneapolis to discuss his thoughts on what's going on with the DevOps world since 2009, as well as his opinions on podcasts having episode numbers. Sadly, no sushi was actually consumed.

item.title: Career Devops With Jeff Hackert - ADO38
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Jeff Hackert discusses developing your career in DevOps.
item.description: In this episode, Jeff Hackert discusses developing your career in DevOps.

item.title: Disasters! - ADO37
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Stephanie Van Dyk and Mark Imbriaco discuss how to communicate and how to recover in the event of complete disasters.
item.description: In this episode, Stephanie Van Dyk and Mark Imbriaco discuss how to communicate and how to recover in the event of complete disasters.

item.title: Dr. BOFH, Or How I Learned To Stop Worrying And Love The DevOps - ADO36
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, 'reformed' Bastard Operators From Hell Yvo van Doorn, Chris Read, and Kevin Hubbard discuss how the industry and their jobs have changed over time, especially with the advent of DevOps.
item.description: In this episode, 'reformed' Bastard Operators From Hell Yvo van Doorn, Chris Read, and Kevin Hubbard discuss how the industry and their jobs have changed over time, especially with the advent of DevOps.

item.title: DevOps And Marketing - ADO35
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Marketing departments are often told, 'Don't use the term DevOps incorrectly!'' But exactly HOW should our marketing peers use that term? How can we effectively talk about DevOps in the marketing space? Shannon Smith from 10th Magnitude and Jason Hand from VictorOps joined us to discuss this heated topic.
item.description: Marketing departments are often told, 'Don't use the term DevOps incorrectly!'' But exactly HOW should our marketing peers use that term? How can we effectively talk about DevOps in the marketing space? Shannon Smith from 10th Magnitude and Jason Hand from VictorOps joined us to discuss this heated topic.

item.title: What'S New At Chef? - ADO34
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Recorded live at ChefConf 2015, we sat down with Julian Dunn, Seth Falcon, and Adam Edwards of Chef Software to talk about all the cool new things that Chef is cooking up - including Chef Delivery, Chef Analytics, and new awesome things with Chef itself!
item.description: Recorded live at ChefConf 2015, we sat down with Julian Dunn, Seth Falcon, and Adam Edwards of Chef Software to talk about all the cool new things that Chef is cooking up - including Chef Delivery, Chef Analytics, and new awesome things with Chef itself!

item.title: DevOps Culture Change With Bill Joy - ADO33
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: DevOps revolves a lot around what an organization and culture should look like. We talk about it on just about every episode of this podcast. Something we tend to skate around though is the how. How do you change the culture of an organization?
item.description: DevOps revolves a lot around what an organization and culture should look like. We talk about it on just about every episode of this podcast. Something we tend to skate around though is the how. How do you change the culture of an organization?

item.title: Starting A New Devops Job - ADO32
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Starting any new job can be a mix of fun, excitement, and nervousness. But what about when you're coming into a DevOps-oriented organization? What are some of the special challenges entering a collaborative, 'blameless' place of work? Katherine Daniels and Jake Champlin join us to discuss their recent experiences of starting at some pretty exciting workplaces.
item.description: Starting any new job can be a mix of fun, excitement, and nervousness. But what about when you're coming into a DevOps-oriented organization? What are some of the special challenges entering a collaborative, 'blameless' place of work? Katherine Daniels and Jake Champlin join us to discuss their recent experiences of starting at some pretty exciting workplaces.

item.title: Docker! Docker! Docker! - ADO31
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: James Turnbull has traveled the world speaking about Docker, and now he's here to tell ADO all about it. The tech, the company, and the community: James has opinions and was more than willing to share them!
item.description: James Turnbull has traveled the world speaking about Docker, and now he's here to tell ADO all about it. The tech, the company, and the community: James has opinions and was more than willing to share them!

item.title: DevOps In A Microsoft World With Jessica DeVita And Jeffrey Snover - ADO30
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Is DevOps just for the open source world? Can you do DevOps in a Microsoft shop? What are some of the tools and capabilities available for Windows, Azure, and .NET professionals who want to approach work in a DevOps model? Microsoft DevOps Evangelist Jessica DeVita and Jeffrey Snover, a Distinguished Engineer at Microsoft and the Lead Architect for the Windows Server and System Center Division, talk with the ADO crew about how Microsoft approaches DevOps.
item.description: Is DevOps just for the open source world? Can you do DevOps in a Microsoft shop? What are some of the tools and capabilities available for Windows, Azure, and .NET professionals who want to approach work in a DevOps model? Microsoft DevOps Evangelist Jessica DeVita and Jeffrey Snover, a Distinguished Engineer at Microsoft and the Lead Architect for the Windows Server and System Center Division, talk with the ADO crew about how Microsoft approaches DevOps.

item.title: Hiring In A Post-DevOps World - ADO29
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: At DevOpsDays Ghent in 2014, it was joked that we are living in a 'post-DevOps world'. What are the challenges in hiring for DevOps related jobs? We be talked with panelists on all sides of the table - recruiting, hiring, and also just some rabble-rousing about why you should stop looking for 'ninjas' and 'rockstars'. Digital Ocean's Jill Jubinski, Datadog's Mike Fiedler, and rabble-rouser Josh Hertz joined Matt and Trevor to weigh in on a this complicated topic.
item.description: At DevOpsDays Ghent in 2014, it was joked that we are living in a 'post-DevOps world'. What are the challenges in hiring for DevOps related jobs? We be talked with panelists on all sides of the table - recruiting, hiring, and also just some rabble-rousing about why you should stop looking for 'ninjas' and 'rockstars'. Digital Ocean's Jill Jubinski, Datadog's Mike Fiedler, and rabble-rouser Josh Hertz joined Matt and Trevor to weigh in on a this complicated topic.

item.title: Incidents And Accidents: Examining Failure Without Blame - ADO28
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Dave Zwieback, VP of Engineering at Next Big Sound and Mike Rembetsy, VP of Technical Operations at Etsy discuss learning from the unexpected and examining failure without blame. With practical tips about technical tools and philosophical insights into the human factors and cognitive biases in play, these industry experts offer useful guidance for the thorny questions around the topic of failure.
item.description: Dave Zwieback, VP of Engineering at Next Big Sound and Mike Rembetsy, VP of Technical Operations at Etsy discuss learning from the unexpected and examining failure without blame. With practical tips about technical tools and philosophical insights into the human factors and cognitive biases in play, these industry experts offer useful guidance for the thorny questions around the topic of failure.

item.title: A Year Of ADO - ADO27
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: It’s been a year of ADO, with topics from CI to security, panels of devs and of ops, and even Pete Cheslock. For the last episode of the year, we thought it would be fun to revisit Matt and Trevor chatting, sans guests - which hasn't happened since the first episode!
item.description: It’s been a year of ADO, with topics from CI to security, panels of devs and of ops, and even Pete Cheslock. For the last episode of the year, we thought it would be fun to revisit Matt and Trevor chatting, sans guests - which hasn't happened since the first episode!

item.title: The Database: The Elephant In The Room - ADO26
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Data - we can’t have applications or services without it. If software is eating the world, then data is the maitre’d. However, it can be challenging to incorporate database design and release into the world of continuous delivery and devops. Grant Fritchey and Jonathan Hickford of Redgate join Matt and Trevor for a discussion of DevOps and Databases.
item.description: Data - we can’t have applications or services without it. If software is eating the world, then data is the maitre’d. However, it can be challenging to incorporate database design and release into the world of continuous delivery and devops. Grant Fritchey and Jonathan Hickford of Redgate join Matt and Trevor for a discussion of DevOps and Databases.

item.title: DevOps In The Enterprise - ADO25
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: DevOps isn't just for startups - in fact, that argument can be made that it's even MORE important for large, enterprise-scale companies than for anyone else. What does it mean to 'do DevOps' in an enterprise? Is there a different flavor of DevOps for enterprise companies? Does CAMS work at scale? Michael Ducy (CHEF Software), Ross Clanton (Target), and Steve Pereira join Matt, Trevor, and Bridget (wat?) to finally tackle this tricky topic.
item.description: DevOps isn't just for startups - in fact, that argument can be made that it's even MORE important for large, enterprise-scale companies than for anyone else. What does it mean to 'do DevOps' in an enterprise? Is there a different flavor of DevOps for enterprise companies? Does CAMS work at scale? Michael Ducy (CHEF Software), Ross Clanton (Target), and Steve Pereira join Matt, Trevor, and Bridget (wat?) to finally tackle this tricky topic.

item.title: Git 101 With Emma Jane Westby - ADO24
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: One of the reasons that DevOps can be transformative to an organization is that it shortens feedback loops - talking about CAMS, the measurement piece is where that can come into play. Anyway, in that spirit, we’re taking feedback we’ve gotten from listeners who want more detailed, technical topics, and we have an episode talking about the HOW with git - with a very special guest, Emma Jane Westby.
item.description: One of the reasons that DevOps can be transformative to an organization is that it shortens feedback loops - talking about CAMS, the measurement piece is where that can come into play. Anyway, in that spirit, we’re taking feedback we’ve gotten from listeners who want more detailed, technical topics, and we have an episode talking about the HOW with git - with a very special guest, Emma Jane Westby.

item.title: Managing Systems In The Cloud - ADO23
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Tom Limoncelli, one of the authors of _The Practice of Cloud System Administration: Designing and Operating Large Distributed Systems_ talks with Matt and Trevor (but mostly Trevor) about the challenges of modern system management.
item.description: Tom Limoncelli, one of the authors of _The Practice of Cloud System Administration: Designing and Operating Large Distributed Systems_ talks with Matt and Trevor (but mostly Trevor) about the challenges of modern system management.

item.title: Devopsdays Chicago - ADO22
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Recorded on Day 2 of DevOpsDays Chicago. Matt and Trevor are joined by a panel of attendees and organizers to talk about their experiences at the first ever DevOpsDays to take place in the Windy City. #deepdishdevops for everyone!
item.description: Recorded on Day 2 of DevOpsDays Chicago. Matt and Trevor are joined by a panel of attendees and organizers to talk about their experiences at the first ever DevOpsDays to take place in the Windy City. #deepdishdevops for everyone!

item.title: Conference Love - ADO21
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Conferences - some people are addicted, and others have never been. What is the point of conferences? What's an unconference? Why shouldn't I just stay home and watch the livestreams? Jason Dixon (Monitorama), Bridget Kromhout (devopsdays Minneapolis), and Pete Cheslock (devopsdays Boston) give their two cents (and more) about why conferences are the place to be.
item.description: Conferences - some people are addicted, and others have never been. What is the point of conferences? What's an unconference? Why shouldn't I just stay home and watch the livestreams? Jason Dixon (Monitorama), Bridget Kromhout (devopsdays Minneapolis), and Pete Cheslock (devopsdays Boston) give their two cents (and more) about why conferences are the place to be.

item.title: Something About Security With Ben Hughes - ADO20
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: When we talk about DevOps, often times we focus only on the two disciplines that feature in the name - Development and Operations. But DevOps, truly, is about collaboration across all areas of the business, even those security blokes. Ben Hughes, Security Manager at Etsy, joins the ADO crew to review how to work WITH your security teams, and show that they're not really scary at all.
item.description: When we talk about DevOps, often times we focus only on the two disciplines that feature in the name - Development and Operations. But DevOps, truly, is about collaboration across all areas of the business, even those security blokes. Ben Hughes, Security Manager at Etsy, joins the ADO crew to review how to work WITH your security teams, and show that they're not really scary at all.

item.title: Dev To Ops - ADO19
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: What does the journey from a background based in Development and moving to an Ops role feel like?
item.description: What does the journey from a background based in Development and moving to an Ops role feel like?

item.title: The Sysadmin Show - ADO18
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Way back in Episode 3, we had a 'Dev focused' show. It's about time to show some sysadmin love.
item.description: Way back in Episode 3, we had a 'Dev focused' show. It's about time to show some sysadmin love.

item.title: Help! I Need Somebody - ADO17
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Matt and Trevor are joined by Dave Gerding, as well as first ever repeat panelist Sasha Rosenbaum, to talk about how to ask for help - and how to get the best help possible with your problems and questions. There's no shame in your game when you need some assistance!
item.description: Matt and Trevor are joined by Dave Gerding, as well as first ever repeat panelist Sasha Rosenbaum, to talk about how to ask for help - and how to get the best help possible with your problems and questions. There's no shame in your game when you need some assistance!

item.title: DevOpsDays Minneapolis - ADO16
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Matt was joined by guest co-host Julian Dunn, as well as some awesome panelists for an on-site recording of ADO at the very first DevOpsDays Minneapolis!
item.description: Matt was joined by guest co-host Julian Dunn, as well as some awesome panelists for an on-site recording of ADO at the very first DevOpsDays Minneapolis!

item.title: Continuous Delivery - ADO15
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: One of the most commonly associated principles with DevOps is that of Continuous Delivery. Continuing (ha ha) upon our previous episode on Continuous Integration, Jez Humble talks about what CD is, how it can help your organization, and how he's seen the world of DevOps change since the first publication of the Continuous Delivery book.
item.description: One of the most commonly associated principles with DevOps is that of Continuous Delivery. Continuing (ha ha) upon our previous episode on Continuous Integration, Jez Humble talks about what CD is, how it can help your organization, and how he's seen the world of DevOps change since the first publication of the Continuous Delivery book.

item.title: How To Eff Up Devops - ADO14
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: DevOps 'Thought Leaders' Pete Cheslock, Nathen Harvey, and Randi Harper help us understand all the things you can do wrong when 'doing the DevOps'.
item.description: DevOps 'Thought Leaders' Pete Cheslock, Nathen Harvey, and Randi Harper help us understand all the things you can do wrong when 'doing the DevOps'.

item.title: Software Deployment - ADO13
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: 'It doesn't count until it's in production.'' How can organizations level-up at delivering software and features to their customers? What are some of the good practices that DevOps can bring to your company? Matt and Trevor are joined by Ranjib Dey, system administrator at PagerDuty, to talk about 'shipping that software.'
item.description: 'It doesn't count until it's in production.'' How can organizations level-up at delivering software and features to their customers? What are some of the good practices that DevOps can bring to your company? Matt and Trevor are joined by Ranjib Dey, system administrator at PagerDuty, to talk about 'shipping that software.'

item.title: Making The DevOps Transition - ADO12
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Matt and Trevor are joined by Jeanne Steinback (Rewards Network) and Chris A (MacArthur Foundation) to chat about their real-world experiences in bringing an organization through a DevOps transition.
item.description: Matt and Trevor are joined by Jeanne Steinback (Rewards Network) and Chris A (MacArthur Foundation) to chat about their real-world experiences in bringing an organization through a DevOps transition.

item.title: DevOps At Etsy: Not A Unicorn, Just A Sparkly Horse - ADO11
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: The engineering team at Etsy are considered by many to be industry leaders when it comes to automation, software delivery, and general DevOps awesomeness. We will be joined by Senior Operations Engineer Jon Cowie (and others) to give an overview of how Etsy does their DevOps magic, and what we can learn from their example.
item.description: The engineering team at Etsy are considered by many to be industry leaders when it comes to automation, software delivery, and general DevOps awesomeness. We will be joined by Senior Operations Engineer Jon Cowie (and others) to give an overview of how Etsy does their DevOps magic, and what we can learn from their example.

item.title: Scaling The Application Mountains - ADO10
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: In today's world of web-scale IT, the ability to respond quickly to increased demand and traffic on your critical applications is an essential component of success. Scaling experts Steven Corona and Igor Papirov join Matt and Trevor to talk about why scaling matters, some good practices to keep in mind, and other tips and tricks for success in the dynamic world of modern applications.
item.description: In today's world of web-scale IT, the ability to respond quickly to increased demand and traffic on your critical applications is an essential component of success. Scaling experts Steven Corona and Igor Papirov join Matt and Trevor to talk about why scaling matters, some good practices to keep in mind, and other tips and tricks for success in the dynamic world of modern applications.

item.title: Fast And Furious: Configuration Drift - ADO9
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: One of the key technologies to help automate your DevOps environment is Configuration Management. There's a lot of chatter around what exactly this means, and how you can use it. Special panel guests Sean OMeara, Chris Webber, and Steven Murawksi join Matt and Trevor to talk about how Config Management can make your systems and stack more stable, predictable, and more fun to manage.
item.description: One of the key technologies to help automate your DevOps environment is Configuration Management. There's a lot of chatter around what exactly this means, and how you can use it. Special panel guests Sean OMeara, Chris Webber, and Steven Murawksi join Matt and Trevor to talk about how Config Management can make your systems and stack more stable, predictable, and more fun to manage.

item.title: Managing Your Mental Stack - ADO8
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: It's information overload these days - how can a technology professional manage to keep up with everything that is new and exciting in the world of DevOps? What are the best methods for absorbing content and developing skills? Just how useful are podcasts, anyway? Matt, Trevor, and special guest Sasha Rosenbaum discuss these topics and their own personal strategies and challenges with keeping their brains from segfaulting.
item.description: It's information overload these days - how can a technology professional manage to keep up with everything that is new and exciting in the world of DevOps? What are the best methods for absorbing content and developing skills? Just how useful are podcasts, anyway? Matt, Trevor, and special guest Sasha Rosenbaum discuss these topics and their own personal strategies and challenges with keeping their brains from segfaulting.

item.title: All Together Now - ADO7
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Angela Dugan of Polaris Solutions and Todd Vernon, CEO & co-founder of VictorOps, join the ADO crew to chat about the challenges of collaborating in a cross-functional team. How can tools help facilitate communication among developers, testers, and operations? What are some of the best practices to keep in mind? And, of course, there just might be some "horror stories" of communication gone horribly wrong.
item.description: Angela Dugan of Polaris Solutions and Todd Vernon, CEO & co-founder of VictorOps, join the ADO crew to chat about the challenges of collaborating in a cross-functional team. How can tools help facilitate communication among developers, testers, and operations? What are some of the best practices to keep in mind? And, of course, there just might be some "horror stories" of communication gone horribly wrong.

item.title: DevOps Mythbusters - ADO6
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: On this episode of Arrested DevOps Matt and Trevor are joined by some of the finest minds in DevOps podcastery - Damon Edwards of DevOps Cafe and Sascha Bates of The Ship Show. The panel addresses some common beliefs on DevOps, and whether these beliefs are true...or just MYTHS.
item.description: On this episode of Arrested DevOps Matt and Trevor are joined by some of the finest minds in DevOps podcastery - Damon Edwards of DevOps Cafe and Sascha Bates of The Ship Show. The panel addresses some common beliefs on DevOps, and whether these beliefs are true...or just MYTHS.

item.title: Continuous Integration – CI Told You So! - ADO5
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: A frank discussion of Continuous Integration
item.description: A frank discussion of Continuous Integration

item.title: Agile And Devops - ADO4
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: How do Agile and DevOps relate?
item.description: How do Agile and DevOps relate?

item.title: The Dev Show - ADO3
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: DevOps from a developer perspective
item.description: DevOps from a developer perspective

item.title: Does Testing Keep You From Making A Huge Mistake? - ADO2
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: What role does testing play in DevOps?
item.description: What role does testing play in DevOps?

item.title: What Is DevOps? - ADO1
item.itunes:author: Matt Stratton, Trevor Hess, and Bridget Kromhout
item.itunes:summary: Matt and Trevor talk about the reason for Arrested DevOps, the format of the show (sort of), and then 'what does DevOps mean?'' Then somehow the topic devolves into open floorspaces and Matt puts his foot in his mouth a few times.
item.description: Matt and Trevor talk about the reason for Arrested DevOps, the format of the show (sort of), and then 'what does DevOps mean?'' Then somehow the topic devolves into open floorspaces and Matt puts his foot in his mouth a few times.
